title: Blood in Need
description: A platform for connecting blood donors with hospitals in real-time.
details:
Blood in Need is a full-stack application designed to streamline the process of blood donation and hospital requests. Users can register as donors or hospitals, view real-time blood requests, and filter donors by blood type and location. The backend is built with .NET MVC and SQL Server for robust data management. Real-time notifications are handled using SignalR for instant updates. Key features include user authentication, request tracking, email alerts, and a responsive design optimized for mobile and desktop devices. The platform emphasizes accessibility, ease of use, and rapid response in emergency situations.

Security measures include encrypted passwords, role-based access, and input validation to prevent data breaches. The project was tested across multiple devices to ensure consistent performance and usability, making it a reliable tool for hospitals and donors alike.

title: Zen Snake
description: A mobile-friendly Snake game with score tracking and note saving.
details:
Zen Snake is a relaxing and interactive game built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The game features smooth gameplay mechanics, touch-friendly controls for mobile devices, and adaptive design for different screen sizes. Players can track their scores across sessions and save custom notes for personal progress tracking or game strategies.

The game includes visual enhancements like dynamic color changes and animations to make gameplay enjoyable. Sound effects, responsive keyboard and swipe controls, and performance optimizations ensure a seamless experience. Code is modular and well-documented, making it easy to extend with new levels or challenges.

This project demonstrates best practices in front-end development, including DOM manipulation, event handling, local storage management, and ensuring a responsive and accessible gaming experience.

title: Learning Journal
description: Tracks weekly activities, reflections, and growth in web development skills.
details:
Learning Journal is a digital diary for tracking learning progress, personal growth, and project development. Built with Flask for the backend and a combination of HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript for the front-end, the journal allows users to add weekly updates, detailed reflections, and notes on learning achievements.

Features include interactive cards, carousel views for past weeks, filtering by topics, and a modal view for expanded content. Users can also upload images, highlight milestones, and review progress over time. The platform uses a clean, modern UI with PWA support for offline access and mobile optimization.

The project emphasizes best practices in web development, including modular code, responsive design, accessibility considerations, and smooth user interactions. This tool serves both as a portfolio showcase and a personal learning management system.
